meanings.definition: To serve as a lackey or menial servant.
meanings.sent1: She was lacqueying for the wealthy family, running errands and cleaning.
meanings.sent2: The butler was lacqueying for the lord, attending to his every need.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be lacqueying for the dog, following it around all day.
meanings.sent4: The sun lacqueying behind the clouds, peeking out occasionally.
meanings.sent5: The student was lacqueying for the teacher, helping with classroom tasks.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as a lackey or menial servant.
meanings.sent1: His lacqueying for the royal family earned him a meager wage.
meanings.sent2: The lacqueying of the servants was essential for the smooth running of the household.
meanings.sent3: The duck's lacqueying for the swan caused quite a commotion in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The wind's lacqueying with the leaves created a rustling symphony.
meanings.sent5: The lacqueying of the ants in the colony was a sight to behold.
